body_html:
@ankitp94 if you need an implementation today (for research, not prod) you should check out https://github.com/rachtsingh/lgamma

@apaszke if you're OK with using source from Eigen, they have an implementation based on Cephes of these functions in C++ which I basically copied for my hacky implementation above. Let me know and I'll start working on a PR. It would be great for variational inference in certain models to have this in pytorch.

@apaszke if you're OK with using source from Eigen, they have an implementation based on Cephes of these functions in C++ which I basically copied for my hacky implementation above. Let me know and I'll start working on a PR. It would be great for variational inference in certain models to have this in pytorch.
body:
@ankitp94 if you need an implementation today (for research, not prod) you should check out https://github.com/rachtsingh/lgamma

@apaszke if you're OK with using source from Eigen, they have [an implementation](https://bitbucket.org/eigen/eigen/pull-requests/173/added-zeta-function-of-two-arguments-and/diff) based on Cephes of these functions in C++ which I basically copied for my hacky implementation above. Let me know and I'll start working on a PR. It would be great for variational inference in certain models to have this in pytorch.
